sentences.en: "Whatever is that row?" she demanded. "Pop festival," he answered.
sentences.cn: “那闹哄哄的究竟是在做什么？”她问道。“是流行音乐节，”他回答说。

sentences.en: A balloon popped.
sentences.cn: 一个气球啪的一声爆了。

sentences.en: a new pop record
sentences.cn: 新的流行音乐唱片

sentences.en: a pop festival
sentences.cn: 流行音乐节

sentences.en: a pop star
sentences.cn: 流行音乐歌星

sentences.en: All at once an idea popped into her head.
sentences.cn: 她脑子里突然冒出一个念头。

sentences.en: An idea suddenly popped into his head.
sentences.cn: 他突然想到了一个主意。

sentences.en: Each corn kernel will make a loud pop when cooked.
sentences.cn: 每粒玉米在烹制时都会发出很响的啪的一声。

sentences.en: He still visits the village shop for buns and fizzy pop.
sentences.cn: 他仍然去村里的小店买小圆面包和汽水。

sentences.en: He was being touted as the most interesting thing in pop.
sentences.cn: 他被吹捧为流行乐坛最有意思的家伙。

sentences.en: His back tyre just went pop on a motorway.
sentences.cn: 他的后胎在高速公路上砰的一声爆了。

sentences.en: I looked at Pop and he had big tears in his eyes.
sentences.cn: 我看着爸爸，他眼睛里泪光盈盈。

sentences.en: I was going to pop up to the local library.
sentences.cn: 我正打算到邻近的图书馆跑一趟。

sentences.en: I'll make the tea and you pop off for a while.
sentences.cn: 我来备茶，你去歇一会儿吧。

sentences.en: Johnny and Guy are the greatest unacknowledged pop songwriters in Britain.
sentences.cn: 约翰尼和盖伊是英国最了不起的、还未被公众认可的流行歌曲创作者。

sentences.en: Pop it in the post, or get your secretary to fax it.
sentences.cn: 把它扔进邮筒，要不然就让你的秘书发份传真。

sentences.en: She has some cockeyed delusions about becoming a pop star.
sentences.cn: 她还幻想着自己能成为流行歌星。

sentences.en: She panics when people pop in unexpectedly, rushing round plumping cushions.
sentences.cn: 一群人冷不防地冒出来，跑来跑去地拍松垫子，这把她吓坏了。

sentences.en: Somalia, pop. 7.9 million, income per head about £1.60 a week.
sentences.cn: 索马里，人口790万，人均收入大约每周1.60英镑。

sentences.en: The film also made use of newsreel footage and vox pop.
sentences.cn: 电影还利用了新闻片片段和街头采访的表现手法。

sentences.en: The lid popped open and juice spilled all over the floor.
sentences.cn: 盖子噗的一声弹开，果汁溅了一地。

sentences.en: The radio had fed him a diet of pop songs.
sentences.cn: 他从广播里听到的都是千篇一律的流行歌曲。

sentences.en: The window opened and a dog's head popped out.
sentences.cn: 窗子打开了，冷不防一只狗探出头来。

sentences.en: these memories can pop up from time to time.
sentences.cn: 这些记忆会时不时地浮现出来。

sentences.en: those swimsuits she wears are $50 a pop.
sentences.cn: 她穿的这些游泳衣每件值50美元。

words.tran_cn: 瞪大眼睛的；（美）（因惊讶而）眼睛突出的
流行的，通俗的；受欢迎的；大众的；普及的
流行地；通俗地；普及地；大众地
服药成瘾者；发出啪声的人或物；爆竹；炮手；爆玉米花机
爆音；突然跳出；爆孔；机器舞
普及，流行；名气；受大众欢迎
大众化的人；普及读物；普及者；使普及的人
出现；爆开；敲击；抛出（pop的ing形式）
推广，普及；使…通俗化（等于popularize）；使…受欢迎
流行音乐；汽水；砰然声；枪击
突然出现；爆开；射击；瞪大；发出爆裂声
取出；开枪打；抛出；突然伸出；突然行动

phrases.phrase: make someone's eyes pop(或美 pop out)

phrases.tran_cn: 流行艺术，波普艺术，通俗艺术
流行音乐会；通俗音乐会
流行文化；通俗文化；波普文化
说气话：在一阵愤怒的突然爆发中不经考虑地脱口说出

trans.tran_cn: 流行音乐的，通俗风格的，通俗的，现代的
流行音乐，汽水，（尤用作称呼）爸，（迅速打上的）记号
trans.tran_en: modern music that is popular, especially with young people, and usually consists of simple tunes with a strong beat
to come suddenly or unexpectedly out of or away from something

trans.tran_cn: （意外地、突然地）出现，突然出现，发出爆裂声，（突然地）行动
（突然地）伸出，（突然地）提出问题，（把准备好的东西）突然拿出来，敲击
